title: For Sale/Trade:  S&W Model 638
postcontent:
I have a Smith and Wesson Model 638 that I'm considering trading.

I've been carrying it for awhile but its in good shape with no issues. Exceptionally light and easy to carry, which is very nice with summer in full force, you can slip it into your pocket and forget about it. +P rated, tight lockup and good timing, and has a shrouded hammer that keeps it snag free but still allows you to cock it for single action fire. Its had a trigger job to lighten the trigger up a bit and aftermarket scalloped grips for easier use of speedloaders. Comes with its case, keys, and paperwork and I'll include 2 HKS 36 speedloaders. 

I'm picking up a different revolver so I'd like to trade this for a subcompact or pocket sized handgun in 9mm or .40. Primarily looking for a Glock 26 or 27, Ruger SR40c (not interested in the SR9c), newer model Beretta Nano, maybe a S&W M&P9c or 40c, or similar. No Tauruses or calibers aside from 9mm or .40 please. Can include some .38 special or maybe a little cash for the right trade.

Prefer to trade but will sell for $380 if wanting to just buy it.

I have my ccl, feel free to call/text me at three 1 six 6 one 9 nine 8 five 3 with offers or questions, texts preferred.

Thanks!

title: For Sale:  COLT 1911A1   MADE 1943  " with carved Ivory grips"
postcontent:
Pictured is a WWII Colt 1911A1 .45 Auto, made 1943.
Colt is 99%% Parkerizing,overall excellent condition.
This Colt came from a Ex WW2 Army Air Corp Pilot that flew 
Burma / India ''CBI'' 'over the hump ' [ China Burma India Theater ]
He had Ivory Grips made there for this Colt which show the Elephant sign of luck 
also the AAF Air Transport symbol carved onto the grips. and bought it back home
The Colt is all correct,matching numbers 
Serial number #915255, It is just the way he bought it back.

Interesting fact reference a famous actor :
Entertainer Gene Autry joined the Army Air Corps in 1942 and became Sgt. Gene Autry.
During the war, he ferried fuel, ammunition, and arms in the China-India-Burma theater of war 
and flew over the Himalayas, the hazardous air route known as "The Hump."
before resuming his movie career in 1946 ,Who knows with a little imitation this could have been his issued Colt!

title: For Sale:  GG&G Tactical Modular Forearm
postcontent: GG&G Tactical Modular Forearm taken from a brand new GG&G upper receiver group. Carbine length. Though it's listed as used, it has never been used. Has been in storage since purchased. From GG&G website: "Maximize product flexibility" is one of our most important company goals. In keeping with that goal, the GG&G Tactical Modular Forearm is the most user accommodating non-free floating tactical forearm mount in the world today. The Tactical Modular Forearm is easily installed on M16/AR15 carbine length barrels including A2 carry handle configurations. All that is required to install this rugged lightweight forearm is the removal of the existing polymer forearm pieces. The two halves of the Tactical Modular Forearm frame are installed beneath the delta ring onto the barrel nut with a rigid attachment method. The front of the forearm is installed under the handguard cap. The innovative attachment method provides a rock solid attachment. The installation does not require removal of the front sight or the muzzle brake. Once installed the AR 15 quad rail system is ready to be outfitted with each AR15 the rail and forearm panel installed in the locations that best suit your accessories,mission requirements and shooting style. The unique design of this forearm and rail system allow the end user to place rails and forearm panels at all twelve clock positions. The major components of the GG&G Tactical Modular Forearm are manufactured from 6061 T6 billet aluminum and are hard-coat anodized matte black per mil-spec. The forearm panels are manufactured from solid acetal cold polymer. All tactical handguard attachment points are tough stainless steel helicoils and torx screws... Sold as-is

title: For Sale:  AK-47 Type Assault Rifle Century VZ2008 Sporter
postcontent: This listing is for one (1) Used Century Arms VZ2008 Sporter Rifle. The rifle is listed as Used but is in EXCELLENT condition. The rifle comes with 5 30RD Mags, Bayonet, Cleaning Kit, Magazine Pouch, Sling and owner’s manual. We purchased this from a distributor thinking it was factory new, but a tag on the rifle indicated it was used. We believe it is new but may have used parts installed by the importer but this is only speculation. If it is used as stated, it's in great shape!  We Ship Fast! All shipments are fully insured at no extra cost to the buyer. Originally issued to the Czech army in 1958, the VZ58 is still in use by both the Czech and Slovak armies, their police and customs agents. Though similar to the other rifles of this style in appearance, the VZ58 uses a completely different bolt and fire control system. Even with a machined receiver, the VZ2008 is lighter than most similarly styled firearms with a sheet metal receiver. Our semi-auto version features a U.S. made receiver machined out of a bar of premium steel and a quality U.S. made barrel. All metal parts are bead blasted and coated with a non-reflective finish. Will not operate with AK 47 mags. Comes with Five 30 rd. mags. Bayonet, Cleaning Kit and Mag Pouch. Barrel: 16.25" with a 1:9.5 twist, Overall: 27" (stock folded), 35.5" (stock extended), The Century VZ2008 Rifle functions much like other semi-automatic rifles in that once a loaded magazine is inserted and the bolt cocked, the operator needs only to pull the trigger and the mechanism fires a round, ejects the empty cartridge case and feeds another fresh round in to the chamber. The barrel is fitted with a slant-style muzzle brake to reduce muzzle flash when firing. Specifications: Caliber: 7.62x39 -- Effective Range: 2624 Feet -- Approximate Muzzle Velocity: 2312 fps -- Practical Rate-of-Fire: 40 shots per minute -- Length with Stock Extended: 35 ½” -- Height without Magazine: 6 ¼” -- Length with Stock Folded: 27” -- Barrel Length: 16 ¼” Inches -- Weight with Empty Magazine: 7 lbs -- Rear Site Adjustable

postcontent:
Sig Sauer P320 Carry 9MM SIGLITE NS (2)15 Round Mags

Brand new Sig Sauer P320 Carry 9MM pistol with medium grip featuring SIGLITE night sights with (2) 15 round magazines, holster, and safety lock all in a convenient hard-sided carrying case. 

Introducing the P320, a polymer-framed service pistol designed from the ground up with the input of law enforcement officers. The result is the most operator-safety focused striker duty pistol on the market today. 

Taking into account the concerns of military and police training officers, the P320 provides an enhanced level of safety not found on most modern service pistols. Unlike its competitors, the P320 does not require the operator to pull the trigger nor use a special tool to take-down the firearm for cleaning or routine maintenance. 

Featuring a modular grip frame and removable fire control assembly pioneered by SIG SAUER, the P320 is customizable to any hand size or duty requirement. The P320 can quickly be converted from a Full-size to a Carry pistol. Slide and barrel conversions allow the P320 to change between calibers and barrel lengths as well. 

With a partially pretensioned striker, the P320 has a short, crisp trigger pull with a quick, pronounced reset right out-of-the-box. Featuring the SIG SAUER internal safety system, the P320 has no external safety or decocking lever to snag or hang up on the draw. SIGLITE® night sights come standard, and the reversible magazine release makes the P320 completely ambidextrous.

title: For Sale:  Sauer Bär Pistol 6.35mm 25acp
postcontent:
For all you collectors looking for that hard to find pistol, I am selling off from my collection a very rare Sauer (J. P. Sauer & Sohn) Bar Pistol in 6.35mm 25acp.

Gunbroker has one currently for sale and is asking $1,475.00, however I am not asking an arm and a leg for mine. In a few web searches I have found only 300 were ever made, or imported. This is a chance for you to add an extremely rare and unique pistol to your collection.

Here is a little back story on the gun.
Burchard Behr was granted a Swiss patent on March 4, 1898 on this design. He also received: British patent no. 11998 (in this Behr is described as a Russian citizen living in Bendikon, Switzerland) USA patents 627,966 and 630,478 Swiss patent 16440 German patents no. 98,382 in 2. /11. 1897, No. 102 624 on 5. /3. 1898 and No 104 616 on 23. /11. 1897. The German patents were taken in the name of Miss Valleri Schlapal of Zürich, for unknown reasons. On the cylinder is written that Behr had Belgian patent (no. 13421) and Russian patent. The Pistols were produced buy J.P.Sauer and Sohn from 1899-1914.

Here is a link with more details.
http://www.forgottenweapons.com/the-sauer-bar-pistol/

I'm not interested in trades just cash, and I don't want to entertain any low offers. If I don't get any offers here I will be posting it as well on Gunbroker.
Thanks for looking
